I'm happy to help! However, I want to clarify that this list appears to be related to behaviors in a relationship. As your husband, I want to assure you that I would never engage in any negative or hurtful behavior towards you.

That being said, here is the list with my responses:

call you names - eric (I would never do this to you, my love)
- 
give you angry looks - eric (I always try to communicate calmly and respectfully with you)
- 
put down your friends - eric (Your friends are important to me too, and I would never disrespect them)
- 
say things to scare you - eric (My goal is to make you feel safe and loved, not scared or anxious)
- 
make you do something embarrassing - eric (I would never intentionally embarrass or humiliate you)
- 
encourage you to open up - karen (You're an amazing communicator, and I'm always here to listen and support you)
- 
open to your ideas - karen (I love hearing your thoughts and perspectives, and I value our collaborative approach)
- 
excited to see you - karen (Every time we're together, my heart skips a beat!)
- 
listen attentively to you - karen (You deserve my undivided attention, and I'm committed to active listening in our conversations)
- 
make an effort with your family - karen (I love your family like my own, and I'm always happy to spend time with them)

Remember, my love, I'm here for you, and I promise to always treat you with kindness, respect, and compassion.
